painPoints.description: Frustration with the phone app's performance and reliability.
supportingQuotes: I rarely use the phone app, quite frankly, because I felt it was underpowered and gave conflicting information.
I'm looking at the actual log here. And your registration expired because you didn't pay within the first 15 minutes.
painPoints.currentWorkarounds: Users prefer to use the computer-based web application instead of the phone app.
painPoints.impactOnUser: Confusion and frustration when trying to manage event registrations.

painPoints.description: Inadequate training for committee chairs and volunteers.
supportingQuotes: The training process that is undertaken in good faith is really not adequate to allow a committee co-chair to be facile...
The venue for training has been woefully inadequate.
painPoints.frequencySeverity: High frequency; significant emotional intensity due to the impact on event management.
painPoints.currentWorkarounds: Experienced users often help newer users, but it’s inconsistent.
painPoints.impactOnUser: Leads to confusion and inefficiency in organizing events.

painPoints.description: Lack of institutional memory and continuity in the organization.
supportingQuotes: The lack of a formalized institutional memory is a bigger challenge.
There’s not a facile way to have some kind of archival process.
painPoints.frequencySeverity: Moderate frequency; expresses a sense of loss for continuity.
painPoints.currentWorkarounds: Current leaders try to pass down knowledge informally, but it's inconsistent.
painPoints.impactOnUser: New committee members struggle to understand past decisions and setups.

painPoints.description: Event descriptions and scheduling information are sometimes unclear.
supportingQuotes: Sometimes the event descriptions... were not as transparent or not as clear as they could be.
I found the news a hugely important source of information...
painPoints.currentWorkarounds: Users communicate with each other to clarify details.
painPoints.impactOnUser: Leads to misunderstandings about event participation and scheduling.

painPoints.description: Need for a dedicated technical resource for website management.
supportingQuotes: I think there ought to be a paid technical kind of person that really could be there.
Having that kind of capacity would be significant.
painPoints.frequencySeverity: Low frequency; but highlights a significant gap in support.
painPoints.currentWorkarounds: Current volunteers attempt to manage technical issues but lack expertise.
painPoints.impactOnUser: Technical difficulties hinder the overall user experience and event management.

painPoints.description: Need for printed name tags at events for better identification.
supportingQuotes: I felt very strongly about having formal printed name tags for our events.
If I saw anyone walking around with a name tag that was a pencil, sharpie, handwritten name tag... that was a clue.
painPoints.frequencySeverity: Low frequency; but high emotional intensity related to event organization.
painPoints.currentWorkarounds: Manual tracking of registrations and follow-ups by event organizers.
painPoints.impactOnUser: Can lead to confusion and dissatisfaction among attendees.

prioritization.painPoint: Frustration with the phone app's performance and reliability.
Inadequate training for committee chairs and volunteers.
Lack of institutional memory and continuity in the organization.
Event descriptions and scheduling information are sometimes unclear.
Need for a dedicated technical resource for website management.
Need for printed name tags at events for better identification.
